wexpman.domainobjects

Class ExperimentCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • wexpman.domainobjects.ExperimentCase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExperimentCaseInfo
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExperimentCaseBatch, ExperimentSingleCase

    public abstract class ExperimentCase
extends Object
implements ExperimentCaseInfo
    An experiment case
    Author:
    Matias Alberto Gavinowich

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String INTERNAL_NAMES_CONCATENATE_STR
      String that will be used to concatenate a parent case name with a child case name to form the full child experiment case name This string must be a valid filename character as some of the files created for the child case may be based upon the generated case name
      protected String name
      The name of this experiment case batch

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected List<ExperimentCase> getChildren()
      Gets the experiment cases contained in this case The default for all implementations is to return an empty list, only implementations that override this method may return something different

      Gets the input this experiment case is based upon

      Gets the name of this experiment case

      Gets a reference to the associated native job

      Gets the name of the owner of this experiment case

      Updates and gets the status of this experiment case Implementations that override this method must also override supportsGetStatus Leaves of the structure (i.e.

      Asks if this experiment case is currently executing on the native submission system

      Asks if a result for this experiment case can be obtained
      static boolean isValidCaseName(String proposedName)
      Asks if the given experiment case name complies with experiment case naming rules These method should be used to check the name before externally creating an experiment case

      Asks if the given experiment case name complies with experiment case naming rules for internally created experiment cases
      protected void removeChild(ExperimentCase childCase)
      Removes the given child case from the cases contained in this experiment case
      abstract void startExecution()
      Starts the execution of this experiment case Updates native job information after submitting the underlying job to the native submission system
      abstract void stopExecution()
      Permanently stops execution of this experiment case Execution will not be allowed to be restarted

      Asks whether the implementation supports getting the result

      • name

        protected String name
        The name of this experiment case batch

      • INTERNAL_NAMES_CONCATENATE_STR

        protected static String INTERNAL_NAMES_CONCATENATE_STR
        String that will be used to concatenate a parent case name with a child case name to form the full child experiment case name This string must be a valid filename character as some of the files created for the child case may be based upon the generated case name

    • Method Detail

      • isValidCaseName

        public static boolean isValidCaseName(String proposedName)
        Asks if the given experiment case name complies with experiment case naming rules These method should be used to check the name before externally creating an experiment case
        Parameters:
        proposedName - the String name that the experiment case to create would have
        Returns:
        true if the given name complies with experiment case naming rules, false otherwise

      • isValidInternallyCreatedCaseName

        protected boolean isValidInternallyCreatedCaseName(String proposedName)
        Asks if the given experiment case name complies with experiment case naming rules for internally created experiment cases
        Parameters:
        proposedName - the String name that the experiment case to create would have
        Returns:
        true if the given name complies with experiment case naming rules, false otherwise

        public String getName()
        Gets the name of this experiment case
        Specified by:
        getName in interface ExperimentCaseInfo
        Returns:
        a String with the name of this experiment case

        public abstract String getOwnerName()
        Gets the name of the owner of this experiment case
        Specified by:
        getOwnerName in interface ExperimentCaseInfo
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the owner of this experiment case

      • getChildren

        protected List<ExperimentCase> getChildren()
        Gets the experiment cases contained in this case The default for all implementations is to return an empty list, only implementations that override this method may return something different
        Returns:
        a List with one ExperimentCase per contained experiment case

      • removeChild

        protected void removeChild(ExperimentCase childCase)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           UnsupportedOperationException
        Removes the given child case from the cases contained in this experiment case
        Parameters:
        childCase - the ExperimentCase to remove from this case children
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given case is not a child of this experiment case
        UnsupportedOperationException - if removing children is not supported, which is the default for all implementations, only those that override this method may support it

      • startExecution

        public abstract void startExecution()
                             throws ExperimentExecutionException
        Starts the execution of this experiment case Updates native job information after submitting the underlying job to the native submission system
        Throws:
        ExperimentExecutionException - if the experiment case could not start executing

      • isExecuting

        public abstract boolean isExecuting()
                             throws ExperimentQueryException
        Asks if this experiment case is currently executing on the native submission system
        Returns:
        true if it is executing, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ExperimentQueryException - if the remote submission system could not be queried for the job

      • isResultAvailable

        public boolean isResultAvailable()
                          throws ExperimentQueryException
        Asks if a result for this experiment case can be obtained
        Returns:
        true if execution is complete on the native system, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ExperimentQueryException - if the status of this experiment case could not be obtained
        UnsupportedOperationException - if getting the completion status is not supported, which is the default for all implementations, only those that override this method may support it, support for this feature can be queried with the method supportsGetResult

      • stopExecution

        public abstract void stopExecution()
                            throws ExperimentExecutionException
        Permanently stops execution of this experiment case Execution will not be allowed to be restarted
        Throws:
        ExperimentExecutionException - if execution of this experiment case could not be stopped

      • getNativeJob

        protected abstract NativeJob getNativeJob()
        Gets a reference to the associated native job
        Returns:
        the NativeJob associated with this experiment case

      • getStatus

        public ExperimentCaseStatus getStatus()
                               throws ExperimentQueryException
        Updates and gets the status of this experiment case Implementations that override this method must also override supportsGetStatus Leaves of the structure (i.e. cases which do not contain other cases) are guaranteed and indeed required to support this
        Returns:
        the ExperimentCaseStatus for this experiment case, if a result is already loaded i will be the instance ExperimentCaseStatus.GOT_RESULT; if the experiment case has no corresponding job on the native (remote) submission system, either because it was never sent or it has been removed, the instance ExperimentCaseStatus.NOT_EXECUTING is returned, in all other cases an ExperimentCaseStatus based on the status of the job on the native system is returned
        Throws:
        ExperimentQueryException - if the status of this experiment case could not be obtained
        UnsupportedOperationException - if getting the status is not supported, which is the default for all implementations, only those that override this method may support it, support for this feature can be queried with the method name accordingly

      • supportsGetStatus

        public boolean supportsGetStatus()
        Asks whether the implementation supports getting the status
        Returns:
        true if getting the status is supported, false otherwise

      • getResult

        public ExperimentCaseResult getResult()
                               throws ExperimentQueryException,
                                      ExperimentNotCompletedException,
                                      ExperimentDataManipulationException,
                                      ExperimentConcurrentAccessException
        Gets the result of this experiment case Implementations that override this method must also override supportsGetResult Leaves of the structure (i.e. cases which do not contain other cases) are guaranteed and indeed required to support this
        Returns:
        the ExperimentCaseResult of this experiment case
        Throws:
        ExperimentQueryException - if the result could not be obtained from the native system
        ExperimentNotCompletedException - if this method was invoked before the experiment case has completed execution
        ExperimentDataManipulationException - if the experiment case result instance to be returned could not be created due to problem trying to store the result data
        ExperimentConcurrentAccessException - if result permanent storage was being used by another instance that refers to this same experiment case, this exception indicates another attempt should be made to get the result
        UnsupportedOperationException - if getting the result is not supported, which is the default for all implementations, only those that override this method may support it, support for this feature can be queried with the method name accordingly

      • supportsGetResult

        public boolean supportsGetResult()
        Asks whether the implementation supports getting the result
        Returns:
        true if getting the result is supported, false otherwise

      • getInput

        public abstract ExperimentCaseStoredInput getInput()
        Gets the input this experiment case is based upon
        Specified by:
        getInput in interface ExperimentCaseInfo
        Returns:
        the input stored in this experiment case
